lines.text: "Is that your real hair or did you scalp an angel?"

[surreptitiously]
There's no time to lose. Do you know what it feels like to be followed, hounded and watched every second?
Well I used to, but now I pay cash for everything.
Look at me.
I'm looking.
You've got to trust me.
I'm not through looking yet.
You mustn't ask any questions.
I'm asking. I mean, I'm not asking.
My name's Karen Bentley. I can't tell you any more.
My name's Larry Haines. There's no more to tell.
Mr. Haines, you're not listening to me.
Yes, I am. I said every word you heard.
Hey, what's this 'Flip and Nip', this 'Floppy Louie' stuff?
No questions please. I'm being followed by two men in black.
You sure you don't mean two men in white?
You and me could make music together. Right now I feel like the philharmonic.

[Trying to get away from Karen]
Taxi! A thin taxi for one!
Larry! Larry! You have 3 hours between trains. Wouldn't you like to go past my apartment house and drop me off?
Drop you off? I sure would. How many stories is it?
[Plane engine sputtering]
What's that?
It isn't moving properly. There's not enough gas to clean a doily.
Oh, that's fine. That's great! That means we're going to be stuck up here where everybody can see us.
[Screaming as plane dives]
I gotta send a wire to Nat Burton. I gotta tell him to get us a lawyer to straighten out this murder business.
Who's Nat Burton?
He's my agent.
Do you think he'll help?
He'd better. If I get the electric chair, he gets 10% of the current.
Let's get out of here before my knees beat themselves to death.
Lady, if I'm not out of that door in 2 seconds flat, my name's not Larry Haines!
[Larry opens the door, sees a knife fly into the wood, and closes the door]

[holding his hand out to Karen]
Meet John Doe!
[Larry switches on the radio]

[on radio]
How d'ya do, ladies and gentlemen, this is Bob Hope, the Pepsodent Kid, still hanging on by your teeth. And I'm here to tell you that I -
[Larry switches off radio]
I can't stand that guy.
[staging a furious argument]
So, I'm a muckfritchetous snitdrivel, am I?
Yes, and you're also a scridgepodge, that's what you are!
[Impersonating a famed pediatrician before a crowd of mothers]
Dr. Higby, I have a girl of nine who won't listen to what's right. She always does what's wrong. What should I do?
lines.character: Mother Who Has a Girl of Nine

lines.text: Wait ten years, and if there's no improvement... send me her number.

[as they're attempting to escape in a small plane, which Karen is going to pilot]
Hey, you sure you know how to run this thing?
Sure! My brother's a British ace.
Yeah, well, my uncle's a dogcatcher, but I can't bark.
